camel.sink.path.port.name: camel.sink.path.port
camel.sink.path.port.description: The port number of the mail server

camel.sink.endpoint.bcc.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bcc
camel.sink.endpoint.bcc.description: Sets the BCC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

camel.sink.endpoint.cc.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cc
camel.sink.endpoint.cc.description: Sets the CC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.replyTo.name: camel.sink.endpoint.replyTo
camel.sink.endpoint.replyTo.description: The Reply-To recipients (the receivers of the response mail). Separate multiple email addresses with a comma.

camel.sink.endpoint.subject.name: camel.sink.endpoint.subject
camel.sink.endpoint.subject.description: The Subject of the message being sent. Note: Setting the subject in the header takes precedence over this option.

camel.sink.endpoint.to.name: camel.sink.endpoint.to
camel.sink.endpoint.to.description: Sets the To email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

camel.sink.endpoint.javaMailSender.name: camel.sink.endpoint.javaMailSender
camel.sink.endpoint.javaMailSender.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.mail.JavaMailSender for sending emails.

camel.sink.endpoint.additionalJavaMailPr.name: camel.sink.endpoint.additionalJavaMailProperties
camel.sink.endpoint.additionalJavaMailPr.description: Sets additional java mail properties, that will append/override any default properties that is set based on all the other options. This is useful if you need to add some special options but want to keep the others as is.

camel.sink.endpoint.alternativeBodyHeade.name: camel.sink.endpoint.alternativeBodyHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.alternativeBodyHeade.description: Specifies the key to an IN message header that contains an alternative email body. For example, if you send emails in text/html format and want to provide an alternative mail body for non-HTML email clients, set the alternative mail body with this key as a header.

camel.sink.endpoint.attachmentsContentTr.name: camel.sink.endpoint.attachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolver
camel.sink.endpoint.attachmentsContentTr.description: To use a custom AttachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolver to resolve what content-type-encoding to use for attachments.

camel.sink.endpoint.authenticator.name: camel.sink.endpoint.authenticator
camel.sink.endpoint.authenticator.description: The authenticator for login. If set then the password and username are ignored. Can be used for tokens which can expire and therefore must be read dynamically.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.binding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.binding
camel.sink.endpoint.binding.description: Sets the binding used to convert from a Camel message to and from a Mail message

camel.sink.endpoint.contentType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.contentType
camel.sink.endpoint.contentType.description: The mail message content type. Use text/html for HTML mails.

camel.sink.endpoint.contentTypeResolver.name: camel.sink.endpoint.contentTypeResolver
camel.sink.endpoint.contentTypeResolver.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

camel.sink.endpoint.debugMode.name: camel.sink.endpoint.debugMode
camel.sink.endpoint.debugMode.description: Enable debug mode on the underlying mail framework. The SUN Mail framework logs the debug messages to System.out by default.

camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers.

camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreUnsupportedCha.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreUnsupportedCharset
camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreUnsupportedCha.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreUriScheme.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreUriScheme
camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreUriScheme.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.javaMailProperties.name: camel.sink.endpoint.javaMailProperties
camel.sink.endpoint.javaMailProperties.description: Sets the java mail options. Will clear any default properties and only use the properties provided for this method.

camel.sink.endpoint.session.name: camel.sink.endpoint.session
camel.sink.endpoint.session.description: Specifies the mail session that camel should use for all mail interactions. Useful in scenarios where mail sessions are created and managed by some other resource, such as a JavaEE container. When using a custom mail session, then the hostname and port from the mail session will be used (if configured on the session).

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.useInlineAttachments.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useInlineAttachments
camel.sink.endpoint.useInlineAttachments.description: Whether to use disposition inline or attachment.

camel.sink.endpoint.password.name: camel.sink.endpoint.password
camel.sink.endpoint.password.description: The password for login. See also setAuthenticator(MailAuthenticator).

camel.sink.endpoint.username.name: camel.sink.endpoint.username
camel.sink.endpoint.username.description: The username for login. See also setAuthenticator(MailAuthenticator).

camel.component.smtps.bcc.name: camel.component.smtps.bcc
camel.component.smtps.bcc.description: Sets the BCC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

camel.component.smtps.cc.name: camel.component.smtps.cc

By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. camel.component.smtps.replyTo.name: camel.component.smtps.replyTo
camel.component.smtps.replyTo.description: The Reply-To recipients (the receivers of the response mail). Separate multiple email addresses with a comma.

camel.component.smtps.to.name: camel.component.smtps.to
camel.component.smtps.to.description: Sets the To email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

camel.component.smtps.javaMailSender.name: camel.component.smtps.javaMailSender
camel.component.smtps.javaMailSender.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.mail.JavaMailSender for sending emails.

camel.component.smtps.additionalJavaMail.name: camel.component.smtps.additionalJavaMailProperties
camel.component.smtps.additionalJavaMail.description: Sets additional java mail properties, that will append/override any default properties that is set based on all the other options. This is useful if you need to add some special options but want to keep the others as is.

camel.component.smtps.alternativeBodyHea.name: camel.component.smtps.alternativeBodyHeader
camel.component.smtps.alternativeBodyHea.description: Specifies the key to an IN message header that contains an alternative email body. For example, if you send emails in text/html format and want to provide an alternative mail body for non-HTML email clients, set the alternative mail body with this key as a header.

camel.component.smtps.attachmentsContent.name: camel.component.smtps.attachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolver
camel.component.smtps.attachmentsContent.description: To use a custom AttachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolver to resolve what content-type-encoding to use for attachments.

camel.component.smtps.authenticator.name: camel.component.smtps.authenticator
camel.component.smtps.authenticator.description: The authenticator for login. If set then the password and username are ignored. Can be used for tokens which can expire and therefore must be read dynamically.

camel.component.smtps.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.component.smtps.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.smtps.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.smtps.contentType.name: camel.component.smtps.contentType
camel.component.smtps.contentType.description: The mail message content type. Use text/html for HTML mails.

camel.component.smtps.contentTypeResolve.name: camel.component.smtps.contentTypeResolver
camel.component.smtps.contentTypeResolve.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

camel.component.smtps.debugMode.name: camel.component.smtps.debugMode
camel.component.smtps.debugMode.description: Enable debug mode on the underlying mail framework. The SUN Mail framework logs the debug messages to System.out by default.

camel.component.smtps.ignoreUnsupportedC.name: camel.component.smtps.ignoreUnsupportedCharset
camel.component.smtps.ignoreUnsupportedC.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

camel.component.smtps.javaMailProperties.name: camel.component.smtps.javaMailProperties
camel.component.smtps.javaMailProperties.description: Sets the java mail options. Will clear any default properties and only use the properties provided for this method.

camel.component.smtps.session.name: camel.component.smtps.session
camel.component.smtps.session.description: Specifies the mail session that camel should use for all mail interactions. Useful in scenarios where mail sessions are created and managed by some other resource, such as a JavaEE container. When using a custom mail session, then the hostname and port from the mail session will be used (if configured on the session).

camel.component.smtps.useInlineAttachmen.name: camel.component.smtps.useInlineAttachments
camel.component.smtps.useInlineAttachmen.description: Whether to use disposition inline or attachment.

camel.component.smtps.headerFilterStrate.name: camel.component.smtps.headerFilterStrategy
camel.component.smtps.headerFilterStrate.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.component.smtps.password.name: camel.component.smtps.password
camel.component.smtps.password.description: The password for login. See also setAuthenticator(MailAuthenticator).

camel.component.smtps.useGlobalSslContex.name: camel.component.smtps.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.smtps.useGlobalSslContex.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

camel.component.smtps.username.name: camel.component.smtps.username
camel.component.smtps.username.description: The username for login. See also setAuthenticator(MailAuthenticator).
